IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of Dallas Theological Seminary is to glorify God by equipping godly servant-leaders for the proclamation of His Word and the building up of the body of Christ worldwide.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of Dallas Theological Seminary is to glorify God by equipping godly servant-leaders for the proclamation of His Word and the building up of the body of Christ worldwide.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION: Dallas Theological Seminary (DTS) offers a variety of graduate academic programs from its main campus in Dallas, TX and its various extension sites. Online courses are also offered. DTS is nondenominational and seeks to serve those of like biblical faith in evangelical protestantism. DTS has over 15,000 alumni serving in 105 countries. Fall 2022 enrollment consisted of 2,614 students, with 15,069 total class hours taken that term.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: STUDENT SERVICES: The mission of student services is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to develop as a godly servant-leader through his or her social, cultural, spiritual, physical, and emotional life. We provide advisement, programming, and services to enrich community, family life, personal interaction, social development, cultural awareness, physical development and campus diversity. The admissions department works to recruit and then equip entering students with the resources needed to have a successful graduate-studies experience. The registrar and counseling offices provide advising, counseling and testing services to facilitate personal, family and professional development. The Chaplains office encourages campus community life, worship, and spiritual development through chapel programming. The Dean of Students office provides opportunities for student participation in decision-making and leadership development through student groups.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ACADEMIC SUPPORT: The library holds over 423,000 items, provides access to electronic resources and has special rare volumes. The media and computer lab allows students to use computer equipment, audio and video media.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: AUXILIARY: Auxiliary enterprises consist of a student bookstore, two student apartment buildings, and a theological journal. Swindoll Tower residence hall has 158 apartments for married students with families and includes a fireside chat room, playroom, and courtyard with a pool. Washington Hall, the single-student apartment building, contains 158 bedrooms in one and two bedroom apartments. Its amenities include a student research library that is an extension of Turpin Library, conference rooms, 2 music practice rooms, 2 media rooms, a multipurpose room/gym, and a pool. Bibliotheca Sacra, a theological quarterly, in continuous publication since 1843, has been published by DTS since 1934.
PUBLIC SERVICE: Hendricks Center for Christian Leadership and Cultural Engagement pursues the development of effective Christian leadership in order to build leaders of integrity and impact.

ContractorName.PersonNm: The Post Oak at Uptown Houston

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The organization is a school as described under 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) and is not required to complete a public support schedule. Schedula A, Part II is completed to verify the school can qualify under public charity status section 170(b)(1)(A)(vii) and, therefore, qualifies to use the first listed special rule for Schedule B reporting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Endowment funds intended uses (Part V, line 4)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowments are intended primarily for student aid scholarships and other academic and operations programs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: General Explanation Attachment
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Part V Dallas Theological Seminary is reporting our consolidated endowment for the Seminary and its affiliated foundation, Dallas Seminary Foundation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governmental Agency Financial Aid (Questions 6a and 6b)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Seminary participates in the Federal Direct Student Loan Program and the Federal Work Study Program and provides administrative support.The Seminary also received grants from the Employee Retention Credit in fiscal year 2022/2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Description of nondiscriminatory policy (Question 3)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Seminary currently enrolls students of racial minority groups in meaningful numbers consistent with the publicity exception found in Rev. Proc. 75-50 section 4.30(2)(b). The Seminarys nondiscriminatory policy is published in the student catalog and on its website.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: North America Not the United States

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.RegionTxt: North America Not the United States

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Use of grant monitoring procedures (Part I, line 2)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Student Finance Office requires applications from all students requesting student aid. All students receiving scholarships and grants are judged worthy by the Seminarys assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards. Student aid for students outside the U.S. is typically a reduction of tuition owed and is rarely given directly to the student in the form of cash.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Supplemental Information (Part V, Other)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Part IV: Upon review of our foreign investments for the year, the Seminary is not required to file forms 5471, 8865, 926, 8621, or FinCEN Form 114.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: General Explanation Attachment
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Pt. II - The Seminary sent funds for the general support of the Evangelical Seminary of West Africa. In order to monitor the use of the funds, the Seminary receives financial statements and regular update reports from them, and the CFO is a member of their advistory committee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Monitoring procedures (Part I, line 2)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Emergency aid: Students are required to substantiate a legitimate need for benevolence before money is awarded. No attempt to verify the use of the money is made.Tuition assistance: Tuition aid is awarded by reducing the net amount the student must pay for tuition.Grants to organizations: Before donating funds to an organization, the Seminary reviews the organizations website to ensure their purposes are not in conflict with the Seminarys exempt mission.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Benefit information (Part I, line 1a)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Occasionally, the Presidents wife travels with him on official business, such as donor trips. The Seminary obtains documentation to verify that a bona fide business reason exists for the spousal travel, and the Seminary pays for the trip when the spouse acts in the capacity of an official Seminary delegate.Certain individuals receiving compensation are ministers of the gospel, and as such, a housing allowance is included in Nontaxable benefits for some of the people listed in Pt. VII.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Third party arrangements (Part I, line 32b)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Seminarys affiliated foundation solicits contributions as a part of the planned giving arm of the Seminary.The Seminary uses a realtor to sell donated real estate, when applicable.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governing body meeting documentation Part VI line 8a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: From the membership of the Board of Incorporate Members (Governing Board) there are assigned members to two subsidiary boards, the Board of Regents and the Board of Trustees. The Board of Regents is entrusted with the general oversight of the faculty and the educational and spiritual functions of the Seminary. The Board of Trustees is entrusted with the direction of the property and financial interests of the Seminary, and authority is given to the Board of Trustees by the bylaws to act legally for the Board of Incorporate Members in all matters of property and finance, such actions being final.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990 governing body review Part VI line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is initially reviewed by an independent audit firm. The audit committee of the Board reviews and approves the public disclosure copy of the form 990. The entire governing Board will be given the public disclosure copy after it is filed with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Conflict of interest policy compliance Part VI line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization requires all officers and board members and key employees to annually complete and sign a conflict of interest questionnaire. The CFO is responsible for reviewing the signed statements and ensuring that interested persons are in compliance with the conflict of interest policy. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: CEO executive director top management comp Part VI line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Boards Compensation and Benefits committee reviews and makes recommendation to the Board of Trustees of the salary level of the President. Comparable salary survey data is used. These decisions are documented in the committee meetings.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other officer or key employee compensation Part VI line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Officers who are not employees are not compensated. The compensation committee reviews the salary levels and comparative salary data of other officers and key employees. This review is documented in the committee minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990 availability to public Part VI line 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Forms 990 and 990-T and other such documents are available upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governing documents etc available to public Part VI line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents, conflict of interest policies and audited financial statements are available to the public upon request. Audited financial statements are also available on the DTS business office website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Explanation of other changes in net assets or fund balances Part XI line 9
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The change in funding status of the defined benefit pension plan, excluding net periodic pension cost, is a $3,576,569 gain/credit. The pension plan was frozen to new employees effective January 1, 2003. Change in value of split-interest agreements was $250,495.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Estimate of average hours per week devoted to related organizations Part VII Col B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Certain directors, officers, and key employees of the Seminary are also directors, officers, and key employees of the Seminarys affiliated foundation. The hours reflected here reflect time spent for both organizations.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Statement of Revenue Part VIII
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Seminary reported Employee Retention Credit grants in Pt. VIII, line 1e based on our audited financial statements of $5,878,256.
